text.__SUMMARY__: Jerdon's worm snake (Indotyphlops jerdoni ) is a species of harmless blind snake in the family Typhlopidae. The species is endemic to India. There are no subspecies which are recognized as being valid.
text.Etymology: The specific name, jerdoni, is in honor of British biologist Thomas C. Jerdon.
text.Geographic range:
Indotyphlops jerdoni is found in eastern and northern India in Sikkim, northern West Bengal, Seven Sisters [Assam], and Meghalaya. Possibly, it also occurs in Bangladesh and Myanmar (Pegu).
The type locality given is "Khási Hills".
